section.title: Build the Universal Installer from Source
section.para: A source code .zip file is provided for building the JBoss Developer Studio universal installer and it is available from the Customer Portal. The procedure below guides you though obtaining the source code and the build process.

important.para: Maven must be installed to build the universal installer from the source code. To obtain Maven see .

procedure.title: Build the Universal Installer from Source

step.para: Log into the Customer Portal at https://access.redhat.com.
From the menu bar click Downloads.
Under Red Hat JBoss Middleware, click Download Software.

figure.title: Download Red Hat JBoss Middleware Software on the Customer Portal

textobject.phrase: Log in to the Customer Portal at https://access.redhat.com. From the menu bar click Downloads. Under Red Hat JBoss Middleware, click Download Software.

step.para:
Under Software Downloads, select the following options:
From the Product list, select JBoss Developer Studio.
From the Version list, select 7.1.x.
From the table, click Download for the Red Hat JBoss Developer Studio 7.1.x Source Code download file. This downloads the sources .zip file.

On the command line, navigate to path/to/.zip and enter unzip jbdevstudio-product-sources-7.1.x.build_version.zip where x.build_version is substituted to match the name of the downloaded file. The archive is extracted to a devstudio directory.

To build the universal installer, on the command line navigate to devstudio/product and enter mvn clean install Building takes some time to complete, after which the universal installer .jar file is located in installer/target/.

section.title: Install JBoss Developer Studio via Script
section.para: Scripts are available for installing JBoss Developer Studio. These remove the need to step through the universal installer GUI, enabling simplified repeat installations or installations in bulk.

There are two methods for completing scripted installations. The first method requires you to install JBoss Developer Studio stepping through the universal installer GUI once and then use a generated script for subsequent installations. The second method requires you to download and run a script and then use a generated script for all installations. These different methods are detailed in the procedures below.

note.para: To install JBoss Developer Studio using scripts, you must first download the universal installer .jar file. You can download the .jar file from on the Customer Portal website.

procedure.title: Install Once and Use a Generated Script to Run Subsequent Installations

step.para: To run the universal installer GUI, on the command line enter java -jar jbdevstudio-*.jarThis generates a InstallConfigRecord.xml file in the directory where JBoss Developer Studio is installed.

To perform repeat installations without stepping through the universal installer GUI, on the command line enter java -jar jbdevstudio-*.jar InstallConfigRecord.xmlThis creates an identically configured JBoss Developer Studio installation.

note.para: The generated InstallConfigRecord.xml file is machine-specific, using the Java developer kit and installation paths of your system. To use the InstallConfigRecord.xml file for systems with different operating systems, Java developer kits or paths, you must manually modify the file.

procedure.title: Run a Script and Use a Generated Script to Run All Installations

step.para: Download the shell script from the URL appropriate for your operating system:
For OS X and Linux-based operating systems,
To run the shell script, follow instructions appropriate to your operating system:
For Microsoft Windows operating systems, on the command line enter jbds-install.cmd
For OS X and Linux-based operating systems, on the command line enter ./jbds-install.sh
This generates a machine-specific jbdevstudio-*.install.xml file.

To perform installations without stepping through the universal installer GUI, ensure the jbdevstudio-*.install.xml file is located in the same directory as the universal installer and on the command line enter java -jar jbdevstudio-*.jar jbdevstudio-*.install.xml

note.para: The downloaded scripts specify a default Java developer kit to be used for installing JBoss Developer Studio: c:\progra~1\java\jre7\bin\java for Microsoft Windows operating systems and /usr/bin/java for OS X and Linux-based operating systems. To use a different Java developer kit, you must manually modify the downloaded script before running it to generate the jbdevstudio-*.install.xml file.
